Important information we received from the DHHS office: If your child was on free or reduced lunch in Nebraska this last school year, you may be eligible for Pandemic EBT (similar to Food Stamps/SNAP). Up to $281 per child. This program is not based on income, only on your child's free or reduced lunch status. Call the SNAP outreach hotline at 1-855-444-5556 - it only takes a few minutes to apply. Please have your child's student ID ready.

If you already receive SNAP benefits, you will automatically receive this benefit. If you do not currently receive SNAP but your child was enrolled in free/reduced lunch please give them a call to apply!

Bulldogs, we hope you are enjoying your summer!

We wanted to share an important update provided by State officials yesterday that set the expectation for schools to open with STUDENTS IN THE CLASSROOM this fall. Please review the direct link to the education portion of the press conference ... http://ow.ly/XbM850A9GNF

The beginning of school may not look exactly like "normal", but with the Department of Education and local public health resources and guidance, district leadership will continue to work on plans that best fit our community and students. It is our goal that students will be in the classroom with minimal disruptions. Safety will always be the first priority followed by quality education.

Below is the 2020-21 school year calendar. At this time, we have every intention of beginning the year according to this Board approved calendar.

Until then, enjoy the rest of your summer - we are so excited to see you this fall!

SUMMER OPPORTUNITY ANNOUNCEMENT: Erica Larsen-Dockray is the Founding Director of the Calibraska Arts Initiative and a panhandle native. This initiative aims to connect youth and adults from Nebraska with west coast artists and professionals in the arts and entertainment industries through arts education. This summer they are offering a variety of online summer classes in the arts taught by teaching artists and professionals in Los Angeles, CA and beyond.

Classes start June 15th and run through July 31st. Registration closes the Wednesday before the start of each class so definitely have a look sooner than later if you can. There are SCHOLARSHIPS in the form of 25%, 50%, and 100% available as well as class material kits available for anyone needing extra help or who may be interested in a series of classes. Check out all the great classes by visiting www.calibraska.org

Gering Public Schools is working closely with the Panhandle Public Health District and Scotts Bluff County Health to monitor the spread of COVID-19 (Coronavirus) within our country and around the world. We have been and continue to:
1. closely monitor illness rates within our buildings, which remain at normal to even below normal levels;
2. take extra steps when cleaning buildings;
3. share information with staff and families about the virus and prevention steps that can be taken to stay healthy; and
4. stay in close contact with local and state health officials.
Panhandle Public Health and Scotts Bluff County Health have developed resources that we are sharing with GPS families. Should circumstances require us to provide you with updates, we will use our normal communication channels.
The link below contains resources provided by local health officials that will help provide information about what we are doing, what everyone should be looking for, and preventative measures that can be taken.
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jJo45CXHauGXcIioZUKClnxtJchIIct9/view?usp=sharing
